4/ The good news is that there are tried and true ways to keep you or your organization safe, like keeping software up to date, enabling two factor authentication, and remembering to never click a link sent by an unknown source.

3/ In Michigan, nearly every school superintendent I talk to tells me their schools have been targeted. Two years ago, a ransomware attack cost MSU over $1 million, and our state government fends off 90 million attempts per day by hackers trying to break into their systems.

2/ People often think cybersecurity is a far-off tech issue, but it really can have a major impact on our daily lives. When the Colonial Pipeline & the JBS Meat company fell victim to ransomware, we saw these attacks can disrupt or disable critical industries & infrastructure.

October is Cybersecurity Awareness Month, which makes it a great time to get up to speed on the real threat of cyberattacks to local institutions here in Michigan ‚Äì like K-12 schools, hospitals, & small businesses ‚Äì and the ways folks can keep themselves protected. 1/

(2/Q2) ‚ÄúFor the PSLF, it‚Äôs slightly more complicated. If you left school and then returned, you can qualify for PSLF if you were working and you had older loans you were paying off.‚Äù
